ai.summary: Amber Valley Routeways Walk 20 is a 9.8 km moderate hike in the UK, offering a varied scenic route along valley paths with gentle hills. It suits walkers with intermediate fitness who enjoy countryside landscapes and a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines woodland trails, grassy meadows, and short stretches of gravel and tarmac. Expect gentle ascents and descents, with potential muddy sections after rain and seasonal changes in footing.
ai.safety_notes: Carry a map and compass or GPS, stay on marked paths, and inform someone of your plan. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing, bring water and snacks, and be prepared for changing conditions. Be cautious at rural road crossings and farm gates; check daylight hours and let someone know if you’ll be out after dusk.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight (if walking near dusk)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (Winter can be challenging due to weather and daylight)
